# AlzheimerVoice.org

> The world's first Cognitive Voice Fingerprint (CVF) engine for early Alzheimer's detection through natural conversation analysis.

AlzheimerVoice identifies subtle linguistic drift years before clinical diagnosis by analyzing 85 vocal and linguistic indicators across 9 cognitive domains. Powered by Claude AI. Fully open source under MIT license.

## Key Facts

- 85 vocal and linguistic indicators analyzed per conversation
- 9 cognitive domains: memory recall, temporal orientation, semantic fluency, syntactic complexity, pragmatic coherence, phonemic stability, lexical diversity, prosodic patterns, discourse organization
- Non-invasive: works through natural conversation (no blood draws, no brain scans)
- Powered by Claude AI (Anthropic)
- MIT open source license
- Available in 9 languages: English, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, Bengali, Portuguese, Russian, Japanese

All pages available in: en, hi, es, fr, ar, bn, pt, ru, ja
